name: Alta Plaza Park
description: Alta Plaza Park is one of the most popular places to play pickleball in San Francisco, CA. There are 2 outdoor concrete courts. The lines are permanent, and portable nets are available. The courts are free. The facility includes amenities like restrooms and water.

name: Angelo J. Rossi Playground
description: Angelo J. Rossi Playground is one of the most popular places to play pickleball in San Francisco, CA. There are 9 outdoor hard and asphalt courts. The lines are permanent, and portable nets are available. The courts are free. Amenities include restrooms and water. You can reserve the courts.

name: Bay Club Gateway
description: Bay Club Gateway is a place to play pickleball in San Francisco, CA. There are 6 outdoor hard courts. These are dedicated courts with permanent lines and nets. Amenities include locker rooms, restrooms, water, and lights. A membership is required to play.

name: Bay Padel Dogpatch Indoor Padel and Pickleball Courts in San Francisco
description: Bay Padel is San Francisco’s premier indoor padel and pickleball club, offering an unmatched experience for players of all levels. Our facility boasts state-of-the-art indoor courts, providing the perfect environment for year-round play regardless of the weather. With a team of dedicated and knowledgeable instructors, Bay Padel ensures every member can elevate their skills in a supportive and dynamic setting. Beyond just a place to play, we pride ourselves on fostering a welcoming community where members connect, compete, and enjoy the vibrant social scene that padel and pickleball bring. Come join us at Bay Padel and experience the best in indoor racquet sports in San Francisco!
fees: Members only — Members play free, non-members pay a one-time free

name: Palace of Fine Arts
description: Pickleball players can reserve 90-minute spots, from 9:30 to 11 a.m., Tuesday through Sunday through the San Francisco Recreation and Park Department’s tennis and pickleball free online reservation system.
